# textColor

**Instance Property**

The color of the text.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var textColor: UIColor! { get set }
```

## Discussion

If you’re using styled text, assigning a new value to this property applies the color to the entirety of the string in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/attributedText] property. If you want to apply the color to only a portion of the text, create a new attributed string with the desired style information and associate it with the label. If you aren’t using styled text, this property applies to the entire text string in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILabel/text] property.

The default value for this property is the system’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIColor/label] color, which adapts dynamically to Dark Mode changes. Setting this property to `nil` causes it to be reset to the default value. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/ui-element-colors].

## Accessing the text attributes

- **text**: The text that the label displays.
- **attributedText**: The styled text that the label displays.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textAlignment**: The technique for aligning the text.
- **lineBreakMode**: The technique for wrapping and truncating the label’s text.
- **lineBreakStrategy**: The strategy that the system uses to break lines when laying out multiple lines of text.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label draws its text in an enabled state.
- **enablesMarqueeWhenAncestorFocused**: A Boolean value that determines whether the label scrolls its text while one of its containing views has focus.
- **showsExpansionTextWhenTruncated**: A Boolean value that determines whether the full text of the label displays when the pointer hovers over the truncated text.
